messages.subject: Re: [Unschooling-dotcom] Petition for Testing Exemption
messages.msgSnippet: Also testing is TOTALLY a state-by-state thing, and any activity (anywhere) which attempts or suggest anything about federal regulations about homeschooling is
messages.messageBody:
Also testing is TOTALLY a state-by-state thing, and any activity (anywhere)
which attempts or suggest anything about federal regulations about
homeschooling is going to get a huge *NO* response from most homeshoolers.

Sandra

messages.subject: Re: [Unschooling-dotcom] Petition for Testing Exemption
messages.msgSnippet: In a message dated 03/07/2001 12:30:31 PM !!!First Boot!!!, mommiesapp@cs.com ... I read this last week.  It is not very well written.  I have written back and
messages.messageBody:
In a message dated 03/07/2001 12:30:31 PM !!!First Boot!!!, mommiesapp@...
writes:


http://www.petitiononline.com/fu111/petition.html




I read this last week.  It is not very well written.  I have written back and
forth with Brad Withers, author of the petition.  He seems like a very nice,
very concerned, very frustrated hser in NY State.  He wants to do something
to help hsers but I don't think he got as many responses as he wanted from
this petition.  I also believe that he is reconsidering the petition idea all
together and is looking to get involved in other ways as well.

Nance

messages.subject: Petition for Testing Exemption
messages.msgSnippet: For anyone intereseted, I got this from my local support group... Subject: petition to sign for exemption of homeschoolers from testing Hi, Thought everyone
messages.messageBody:
For anyone intereseted, I got this from my local support group...


Subject: petition to sign for exemption of homeschoolers from testing

Hi,

Thought everyone might want to consider signing this. Follow the link
and read it for yourself.

http://www.petitiononline.com/fu111/petition.html
